<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 11+"
    pfs=""
>
[Inubrix Weapon](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1418)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 99</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** varies by weapon

**Bulk**  varies by weapon
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

**Base Material** [Inubrix](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1415)

</column>

---

While inubrix weapons don't pack the same punch as more durable weapons, they have the unique ability to bypass some of the protections offered by metal armors and shields. A weapon crafted from inubrix reduces the weapon's damage die by 1 size. However, they ignore the resistance to damage from metal armor's armor specialization effects and the circumstance bonus to AC from metal shields. Strikes with inubrix weapons don't trigger the [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) reaction from a metal shield. Weapons that normally deal 1d4 damage can't be crafted from inubrix.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

**Craft Requirements** at least 175 gp of inubrix + 17.5 gp per Bulk
